frame.name: Physical_entity
frame.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> exists in some <fen>Place</fen> at some time.</def-root>

FE.name: Constituents
FE.definition:
<def-root>Salient parts that make up a locale.
<ex>This is the oldest <fex name="Constituents">oak</fex> <t>forest</t> in Dorsetshire.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition: <def-root>A thing (either abstract or physical) that exists with some degree of permanence. </def-root>

FE.name: Formational_cause
FE.definition: <def-root>Indicates the action (or causer) which brings the features of the locale about. <ex><fex name="Formational_cause">glacial</fex> <t>valley</t></ex> <ex><fex name="Formational_cause">impact</fex> <t>crater</t></ex> Should also include words that indicate that there was no salient formation: <ex><fex name="Formational_cause">virgin</fex> <t>woodland</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition: <def-root>ULTIMATELY TO BE <m>replaced</m> BY MULTIWORD <t>Targets</t> (in almost all cases). This FE is used for the names of locales. <ex><t>Lake</t> <fex name="Name">Constance</fex></ex> <ex><fex name="Name">Pike's</fex> <t>Peak</t></ex> <ex>The <t>city</t> <fex name="Name">of Paris</fex></ex> <ex>The <fex name="Name">Indonesian</fex> <t>archipelago</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates what subtype of the general category the <fen>Entity</fen> belongs to. </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>A place that a physical <fen>Entity</fen> is located with respect to.
<ex>All the <t>things</t> <fex name="Place">on the bureau</fex> are small.</ex></def-root>
